Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What about this one? It's kinda badass, right? Just seems kinda crazy in a way I might need right now.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't know. [looks at Stanley, who took his mug and is drinking out of it] Oh! That's... not... yours.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stanley just drank OJ out of my mug, and didn't seem to realize that it wasn't his hot coffee. So the question has to be asked, is there no limit to what he won't notice?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: What's a seven letter word for purse?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [sitting at Phyllis' desk, dressed like Phyllis; high pitched voice] Satchel!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Nope. Starts with an H.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [shirtless, wearing only a tie] Handbag.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Hmmm. [glances at Andy] Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Shh! Shhh! [watches Jim put a cardboard box over Stanley's monitor]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [standing outside the conference room, wearing fake teeth, watching Stanley walk in] All right, everybody, take a seat. As you may have heard, our branch on the planet Jupiter is up eight thousand percent in sales!

Quote.Speaker: All
Quote.Text: Yay! [applause]

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [looks at the clock, then at his watch] Hold up! That clock is slow. It is five o'clock, I will see you all tomorrow:

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [turns around, is wearing a mustache] Bye, Stanley! Love you! [waves, Stanley leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [standing next to a pony] So long, Stanley!

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Night, everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: So what kind of statement are you making with that costume, Kevin?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: The statement that I am making, Oscar, is that I kind of look like Michael Moore.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Dunder Mifflin, this is Erin! Happy Halloween! How can I haunt you today?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: A lot of people are really getting into Halloween this year! [puts head down over fake bomb made from cardboard, high pitched voice] Six seconds, MacGruber! [lifts head] Pam's got a lot of fun stuff planned! [puts head down, high pitched voice] Uh, two seconds MacGruber! [lifts head] Including a... costume contest, and bobbing for apples, and a Ouija board... OHHH! BOOM! OHH EXPLOSION! [throws fake bomb, takes off sunglasses, points to camera] MACGRUBERRRR!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: People are really into the costume contest this year. Might have something to do with the prize, maybe you've heard of it. The 2011 Scranton Wilkes-Barre coupon book worth over fifteen thousand dollars in savings!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Stop.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [has his hands around Jim's neck] Too late! If I was the real Scranton Strangler, you'd be so strangled right now. If you're out there, strangler, you will get caught! By me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Sounds like someone's really trying to convince us that he's not the Scranton Strangler.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: To my chickens I'm the Scranton Strangler. [looks at Pam] Oh-ho! That's very funny. Looks like someone decided to dress up as old Dwight Schrute's mom.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You're only one third as beautiful and only half her height.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm supposed to be Olive Oyl. And it makes more sense when I'm standing next to Popeye, but... Jim doesn't want to put his costume on.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [places pipe in mouth] I am Popeye!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I've never really been a costume guy. Even when I was a kid, it just felt like something I was too old for. And then this morning, when Pam hands me this little number [holds up Popeye costume, shakes head] ...no.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [dressed as Lady Gaga] In case you can't read m-m-my Poker Face... [laughs] we will be reviewing our sales policies. [accepts note from Michael, reads it out loud] I have ten seconds to read them or this whole place blows up.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: MACGRUBER!

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Lame. Why don't witches wear panties?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, here we go!

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Because they need to grip the broom!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [laughs] OH! Who likes to water ski on Lake Erie? No wai-where does Dracula like to water ski?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Lake Erie.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: When our warehouse workers make deliveries, they're going to be encouraged to offer clients extra products. And then they will split those commissions with sales.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So, wait, drivers are going to be able to sell paper on the road?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: That is correct.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Has anyone started calling you "Gabe-wad" yet?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Not here.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Gabe-wad.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay, guys, fun is fun, but-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Blackula!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Dracula.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, so... I almost forgot. You'll find this hilarious. Apparently corporate is going to have drivers sell paper on their routes now. That's like, exactly sort of the idea that you had.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes. I do remember saying something like that to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah. I'm sorry. I blew this. You should have gotten credit for that, man.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm just glad we're gonna try it out.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Really? We're good?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yeah. We're cool.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. [reaches out and shakes Darryl's hand] Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What's under your shirt?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh. It's a ream of paper. Thought you might hit me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Darryl Philbin is the greatest guy in the world. And you know what I'd like? I would like to have all the racists brought together and take Darryl Philbin out to lunch. Just to see what they're missing.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: [leans hobo sack against the refrigerator] It's a great stick, right?

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: It's really good. It's a classic. I think you might win the whole thing with that.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Thanks!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Everyone realizes that this coupon book isn't actually worth fifteen thousand dollars, right? You'd have to spend two hundred thousand dollars on crap you don't actually need to get fifteen thousand dollars worth of benefits. I'm not the only one who sees this, right?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: I get that. I get that.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Excuse me, everybody. I want to invite you all to the Halloween party I'm having at my bar.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: You own a bar?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Public School, at exit 11.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's a great name. You're hilarious. A plus!

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: So. You're all on the list!

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Hey, man, can I get a plus five? It's all guys.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey, what's the crowd like, Danny? Our age?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I don't think that she would leave Jim for Danny.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I don't know, they're both handsome.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Pam is gonna choose whoever has a scent most like that of her father. Does anyone remember what her dad smelled like?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I think he-

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey hey hey, quiet, here she comes! Did you hear about that Danny guy? Heard he used to date Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So four years ago, when I was in Stamford, Connecticut, and dating someone else, Pam went on two dates with Danny. Which was obviously the greatest love story ever told, given how much people are walking on eggshells around us.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: We were basically Romeo and Juliet.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's right.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Except where Juliet doesn't have that great a time and Romeo doesn't call back after two dates.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yikes.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: But I've learned to love again. [puts her arm on Jim's shoulder] He's a cartoon sailor.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh, no.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: And looks so handsome in his UNIFORM! Please?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: No. No, I'm not gonna-no.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Tuna! Tuna! Do you want us to skip this party?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I don't care.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I am never gonna forget what Danny did to Pam. I forget nothing. I'm like an elephant in that way.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You know what else? [pulling fake teeth out of his mouth] The-this... this sucks for Jim. Right? But it also sucks for us. Because we don't get invited to a ton of Halloween parties. [puts teeth back in]

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, and everyone else is gonna be there. Stanley, Phyllis, Angela, Darryl... Creed's a maybe.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [removes teeth] Creed's going?!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Madge from the warehouse just made her first sale. Madge. We should have been doing this a long time ago.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Erin! Would you please do me a solid and get Darryl Philbin on the speakerphone?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: [answers phone] Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hi, Darryl, come out here, please.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm good.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You need to stop being so shy, come out here, and embrace who you really are, superstar!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This is embarrassing, Michael.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I bet it is! If you're gonna do your job well here, you gotta get used to being embarrassed.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Let me put my shoes on. [hangs up phone, dial tone]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [leans over toward Erin] Um, hit the speakerphone button. The speakerphone button? The same button as you hit before... or sit on it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: This whole delivery slash sales idea? You know whose idea that was? That was Darryl Philbin's. He thought of that way before the corporate fat suits.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: So, what happened?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I got in the way. I said no. And it just stopped. But then corporate comes up with this idea, but you know what? They need to know that it was yours. And I don't care if I take a bullet. We're gonna call them, we're gonna put them on speakerphone right now...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh! [fumbles for phone]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: And we are going to straighten this out.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Screw corporate! They probably stole the idea anyway.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Mmhm!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Uh uh. Corporate stole nothing, okay? Darryl told me, and then I told them, giving Darryl full credit, so... no need to [mimicking Andy] screw corporate! Or anything like that, so. Let's give Darryl a round of applause, as planned. [claps]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I'm a little peeved at Darryl right now.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He went to Gabe behind your back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: No, he didn't go behind my back. He went over my head.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: He went over your head to go behind your back.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What is taking someone from behind?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No. Shh. Michael, listen. This cannot stand. We can't have workers going straight to corporate. Makes your job superfluous.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: It was a good idea, though.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah. Here's another good idea. Corporate chain of command. We need to strangle Darryl's idea.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, Danny.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm really sorry, but we can't come to your party tonight.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: I was looking forward to throwing some darts with you guys.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You were?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay, well then, uh, I mean, maybe we could do it like... next Halloween.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: For sure.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We're just like, totally caught in the middle here.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: What are you talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well Jim and Pam basically begged us not to go...

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Jim and Pam really don't want you to go?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: They're really upset about the whole Danny situation.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: I'll talk to them.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Yeah, but wait, don't tell them that we said anything to you.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Or you're dead.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Kelly! Great costume!

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: KELLY! You cannot change costumes in the middle of the day! Pam, she's out.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Um, if I'm out, I'm going to sue this ENTIRE COMPANY for discrimination.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Guys? You're arguing over a one in sixteen chance. Over a prize worth... forty bucks.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Um, fifteen thousand bucks, Oscar.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yeah, shut it, Oscar. Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: This is an amazing prize. I mean, I don't even want to give Pam a compliment, because she's so blegh, but she did a good job. I really want that coupon book.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Garbage magnet. [throws magnet] Garbage magnet, God! Magnets are interesting enough, you don't need to tart them up with some design. [to Michael] I can't believe this doesn't make you mad!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: [staring at Gabe and Kevin] What the hell are they talking about?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Hmm, Kevin and Gabe. Probably about the extremes of the human physique.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Do you think that Kevin is going over my head? I don't-[sees Kevin and Gabe fist-bump] Oh my GOD. Okay. All right. All right. You know what? That's inappropriate, Kevin. I am your boss, and if you have something to say, it goes through me, and then I take it to Gabe. Chain of command. Do you understand?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I am so sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh, you're sorry?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I just thought-

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What did you just thought?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Well, Gabe asked me if there were any really cool Lady Gaga moves that he could do for the catwalk. And so then I tol-[tries not to cry]

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: All right.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I told him that there was this one cool move where she powers down like a robot.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Okay? But I- I am so sorry that I didn't tell you first.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well, don't let it happen again.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [hysterical] You think that I would let this happen again?! NO WAY JOSE.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I-

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: [bleep] you, Gabe!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay...

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Can you imagine? It's just crazy.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That is crazy. We would never care if Andy or Kevin went to your party.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Look, I'm just glad we can laugh about it. Because I was a little nervous about coming to work here, with, you know, our history.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, my gosh! People keep blowing it out of proportion! It's not even a history.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Exactly.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's not like you guys had some long relationship right? Big painful breakup I don't know about?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: No! Two or three dates.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: It was two.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Was it two? I thought it was three.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: No, we um, we had plans for a third, but then I don't know, you never called me back, so...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oooh! You can't handle the truth! [laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: [laughing] Well, that does not sound like me.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah? [stops laughing] It was though, that's what happened.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: [stops laughing] Well, great, I just wanted to make sure that things weren't weird.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hmm-mm.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, this whole going over my head-gate? Is making people act weird. The chain of command is crumbling. Do you know what just happened? I just made Kevin cry. And Gabe looks like Lady Gaga. That's not Halloween. Halloween should be a day in which we honor monsters and not be mad at each other.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I'm not mad. Are you mad?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You went over my head. And then you lied to my face. So my head and my face have taken a beating.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Well, I'm sorry if it seems that way to you.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay, that might help. If you said "I'm sorry" in front of everybody.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Mike.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: In front of me.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You made a bad call. And I fixed it. So I'm not apologizing.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: So that's it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: That's it.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Is it?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Sookehhh. [removes teeth] Bill Compton, from True Blood.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: How many freakin' vampires am I supposed to care about these days?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I guess you could say I'm still in costume. I'm a rational consumer.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Stupid coupon booklet. Have you seen my costume? I'm a rational consumer.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Yeah, I uh, heard you say it to Phyllis. That's a good line.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, everybody! After you walk the runway everyone has to vote for who gets the coupon book. And you can't vote for yourself.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pam. Can you vote for other people?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Yeah, I gotta get in on this. [mocking Darryl] Hey, it's cool, man, I work in the warehouse! I'm cool! I'm hip and I'm jive! And I don't care about nobody! Do you know who I am? Happy Halloween, jerk!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Still don't know who I am? I'll give you a hint. I go over other people's heads.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Michael, this is a bad idea.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: What's a bad idea?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Dressing up as somebody-I mean, when has that ever worked for you?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: NEVER! [tosses wig] Okay, you know what? Fine. I'm not Darryl. And thank God I'm not Darryl.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: Could you for once just let us enjoy a party instead of making it about all your issues?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: [walking down the runway] Raaah! [waves sword]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I present to you the [finger quotes] rational consumer, as it were.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Angela as the nurse!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I don't like your tone! Look, they were sold out of all the other costumes, okay? I think we all live in the real world, here. Let's not pretend to be unaware of what sells in this office.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What should we ask?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Hey, can I play? Why don't you ask if Darryl is a bad friend who backstabs people in the back?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: We have one question to ask the spirit world and you want us to ask that?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He says no.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Aaah! Darryl moved it. You moved it.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Dwight, you saw Darryl move it, right?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's just say I saw exactly what the two of you wanted me to see.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I know how to sit on a fence. Hell, I can even sleep on a fence. The trick is to do it face down with the post in your mouth.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If you had one word you would use to describe Darryl what would that word be?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: [hands are being forced to the letters] A... S... S... H... E... T?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: An asset!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Ah! [lets go, candy corn flies everywhere] That's enough.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: I don't think it's gonna work out the way you think.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: I don't think you get it.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: This is some party, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: When you work hard, you play hard around here. Even if you don't work hard. Oh, here's something. Uh, why didn't you ever call Pam back?

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Are you serious?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah. I mean, I'm not saying that everyone has to fall in love, or anything, I'm just saying... but you know, to not even call her back is...

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: You know what it was? I think she gave me her number but then her fours look like eights, and...

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Could be. But you also called her the second time so you had the number right.

Quote.Speaker: Todd Packer
Quote.Text: Halpert, you lookin' for someone to bang your wife?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Nope.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Okay. You wanna know? I didn't call her back because she spent the whole date talking about you. She was obviously in love with you.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Fifty seven. Fifty eight.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Wait, wait. She hasn't moved in awhile.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: [reaches over to pull Erin out of apple bobbing water] ERIN!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Two! I got two. I ate two whole apples.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'd remember talking about Jim. That wasn't it.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Just tell her the real reason.

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Do you honestly want to know why I didn't call her back on a date over four years ago?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey. She had a nice time. It seems rude.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I did. And it's just one of those things that's going to keep gnawing at me, like "gnaw, gnaw, why? Why didn't he? I have no idea why."

Quote.Speaker: Danny
Quote.Text: Okay. Honestly. I didn't call you back because I-thought you seemed a little... dorky.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, man.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thank you! Thank you. I got it. Now I know. You thought I was a little dorky. You know? [gibberish sounds] Okay. Well, excuuuuse me.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: In the future, you need to get Michael's approval on anything before coming to me.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You're gonna be missing out on some good ideas.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay, well, obviously if it's a really, really good idea, my door is open.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: If they're good ideas, I'm not gonna say no!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You said no to this one!

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: That was-okay, you make one mistake in fifteen years and you drag me over the coals, after everything I did for you?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What have you done for me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Oh...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: What have you done for me?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Well...

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Ed Truck hired me. Jo promoted me. Gabe listened to me. All you've ever done is say no to me. I have ambition. And you kept me at the same level for years.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Ohh. Dropping bombs, right? [explosion noise] This really make you think, Michael?

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Stop it! Stop, stop. We're thinking. We're thinking about it.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: You don't have to point to the fact that we're thinking about it. Stop it! Just let us think. Okay, next time you have a really great idea, we will put it in a hat, and then we will have Erin pick it out of the hat and let her decide.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: I don't understand the point of a hat.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You're right, we don't need a hat.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: I am not budging on the hat issue.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay. We're going to table the hat question. The best ideas are going to come to me, I make the final decision, period.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Okay. We both reserve the right to go to Jo if we disagree with Gabe.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Okay, why don't we simplify this? Darryl brings it to Michael, Michael brings it to me, no one calls Jo.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Unless you and I decide we want to talk to Jo, then we'll give her a call.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Cool. Okay. Sorry I lied.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Sorry I was a jerk.

Quote.Speaker: Michael
Quote.Text: Friends fight. Friends fight.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What's up, man?

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Sometimes it seems like it was better down in the warehouse, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: When I was a freshman in college, I worked at the student newspaper, the Cornell Daily Sun? This was at Cornell. I had to write an op-ed column every day. Bernard's Regards.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: This was your freshman year.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I started to ask myself, "Do I have big plans here?" I didn't want to become editor of that paper, so I got up and walked right out of Walter Bernard hall, and that's actually when I heard eight male voices, singing, unencumbered by instruments. I was hooked. So is becoming CEO of this company your a capella group? Come on, we're going to Danny's bar. Public School.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: No. I got some work to do. I do got big plans with this company.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: To be honest, I still can't believe he didn't call her back. Who doesn't call a dork like that back?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, wow!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [holding Cece] Spinach in a can. Power eat spinach. [Popeye sound]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Aww, my hero!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Okay, everyone, I've tallied the votes, and the winner... of the costume celebration spectacular... and the Scranton Wilkes-Barre coupon book... Oscar Martinez.

Quote.Speaker: Kelly
Quote.Text: If I have to vote for someone, I don't want it to be someone who can beat me.

Quote.Speaker: Ryan
Quote.Text: Shake things up. I'm a Nader guy.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Best Edward James Olmos costume I've ever seen. Like, freaky good.
